Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the occurrence of snow in Egypt by stating that it is the first time in 112 years, even though snowfall has been recorded in Egypt before.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misleading photos that were not taken in Egypt.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photos accurately depict snow in Egypt, when in fact they are either manipulated or taken in different locations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that snowfall has been recorded in Egypt before, suggesting that it is a rare occurrence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the photos are not of snow in Egypt but of snowfall in other locations such as Jordan, Israel, and China.
